thread.title: Luxury speedboat trips & free elephant riding at Sofitel Krabi
thread.title_full: Luxury speedboat trips & free elephant riding at Sofitel Krabi

author: Phuketindex
title: Luxury speedboat trips & free elephant riding at Sofitel Krabi
text:
Home » Features , Travel & Food » Luxury speedboat trips & free elephant riding at Sofitel Krabi Luxury speedboat trips & free elephant riding at Sofitel Krabi Written by Phuketindex | September 9, 2015 | 0 | Luxury private speedboat trips & free elephant riding at Sofitel Krabi 
Krabi, September 2015 – During your stay at Sofitel Krabi Phokeethra Golf & Spa Resort, buy two packages for a private speedboat trip to Phi Phi Island and a half day trip to Krabi 4 Islands and receive 1 hour elephant riding for free! 
• Full Day Phi Phi Island Experience dramatic landscapes, breathtaking natural beauty, idyllic beaches, crystal clear waters, and glorious island coral reefs teeming with fish. Known as “the jewel of the Andaman Sea”, our unforgettable trip to Phi Phi Island includes some of the best snorkeling spots in the region. THB 30,000++ per trip (maximum 6 persons) and THB 1,500++ for an additional guest. 
• Half Day Krabi 4 Islands See all the highlights of Krabi on our popular half day 4 Islands tour by luxury speedboat. Whisk to Tup & Mor Island, Chicken Island, Poda Island and Railay Beach, where you will enjoy powder white sand and crystal clear water with pristine coral and tropical fish. On this memorable day of adventure and discovery our crew take you by luxury speedboat to some of the most breathtakingly beautiful locations around Ao Nang. THB 20,000++ per trip (maximum 6 persons) and THB 1,000++ for an additional guest. 
Get free! Complimentary 1 hour elephant riding (maximum 6 persons) Just seven kilometres from Ao Nang where the natural surroundings provide permanent shade and abundant water for the animals all year round, the elephant trek takes nature lovers along a river running through the forest. Highlights include beautiful scenery, and possible sightings of monkeys and birds living in their natural habitat. The elephants are used to people and pose no danger to either adults or young children. 
For further information or reservations, please contact 075 627 800 or write an email to H6184-RE@SOFITEL.COM
